wsknn.evaluate package¶

Submodules¶

wsknn.evaluate.metrics module¶

wsknn.evaluate.metrics.get_mean_reciprocal_rank(sessions: List, trained_model: wsknn.model.wsknn.WSKNN, k=0, skip_short_sessions=True, sliding_window=False) → float¶

The function calculates the mean reciprocal rank of a top k recommendations. Given session must be longer than k events.

Parameters

  • sessions (List of sessions) –

    [

    [ sequence_of_items ], [ sequence_of_timestamps ], [ [OPTIONAL] sequence_of_event_type ]

    ], [other session]

  • trained_model (WSKNN) – Trained VSKNN model.

  • k (int, default=0) – Number of top recommendations. Session must have n+1 items minimum to calculate MRR. Default is 0 and when it is set, then k is equal to the number of recommendations from a trained model. If k is greater than the number of recommendations then the latter is adjusted to it.

  • skip_short_sessions (bool, default=True) – Should the algorithm skip short sessions when calculating MRR or should raise an error?

  • sliding_window (bool, default = False) – When calculating metrics slide through a single session up to the point when it is not possible to have the same number of evaluation products as the number of recommendations.

Returns

Mean Reciprocal Rank: The average score of MRR per n sessions.

Return type

float

wsknn.evaluate.metrics.get_precision(sessions: List, trained_model: wsknn.model.wsknn.WSKNN, k=0, skip_short_sessions=True, sliding_window=False) → float¶

The function calculates the precision score of a top k recommendations. Given session must be longer than k events.

Parameters

  • sessions (List of sessions) –

    [

    [ sequence_of_items ], [ sequence_of_timestamps ], [ [OPTIONAL] sequence_of_event_type ]

    ], [other session]

  • trained_model (WSKNN) – Trained VSKNN model.

  • k (int, default=0) – Number of top recommendations. Session must have n+1 items minimum to calculate Precision. Default is 0 and when it is set, then k is equal to the number of recommendations from a trained model. If k is greater than the number of recommendations then the latter is adjusted to it.

  • skip_short_sessions (bool, default=True) – Should the algorithm skip short sessions when calculating Precision or should raise an error?

  • sliding_window (bool, default = False) – When calculating metrics slide through a single session up to the point when it is not possible to have the same number of evaluation products as the number of recommendations.

Returns

Precision: The average score of Precision per n sessions.

Return type

float

Notes

Precision is defined as (no of recommendations that are relevant) / (number of items recommended).

wsknn.evaluate.metrics.get_recall(sessions: List, trained_model: wsknn.model.wsknn.WSKNN, k=0, skip_short_sessions=True, sliding_window=False) → float¶

The function calculates the recall score of a top k recommendations. Given session must be longer than k events.

Parameters

  • sessions (List of sessions) –

    [

    [ sequence_of_items ], [ sequence_of_timestamps ], [ [OPTIONAL] sequence_of_event_type ]

    ], [other session]

  • trained_model (WSKNN) – Trained VSKNN model.

  • k (int, default=0) – Number of top recommendations. Session must have n+1 items minimum to calculate Recall. Default is 0 and when it is set, then k is equal to the number of recommendations from a trained model. If k is greater than the number of recommendations then the latter is adjusted to it.

  • skip_short_sessions (bool, default=True) – Should the algorithm skip short sessions when calculating Recall or should raise an error?

  • sliding_window (bool, default = False) – When calculating metrics slide through a single session up to the point when it is not possible to have the same number of evaluation products as the number of recommendations.

Returns

Precision: The average score of Recall per n sessions.

Return type

float

Notes

Recall is defined as (no of recommendations that are relevant) / (all relevant items for a user).

wsknn.evaluate.metrics.score_model(sessions: List, trained_model: wsknn.model.wsknn.WSKNN, k=0, skip_short_sessions=True, calc_mrr: bool = True, calc_precision: bool = True, calc_recall: bool = True, sliding_window: bool = False) → Dict¶

Function get Precision@k, Recall@k and MRR@k.

Parameters

  • sessions (List of sessions) –

    [

    [ sequence_of_items ], [ sequence_of_timestamps ], [ [OPTIONAL] sequence_of_event_type ]

    ], [other session]

  • trained_model (WSKNN) – Trained VSKNN model.

  • k (int, default=0) – Number of top recommendations. Session must have n+1 items minimum to calculate MRR. Default is 0 and when it is set, then k is equal to the number of recommendations from a trained model. If k is greater than the number of recommendations then the latter is adjusted to it.

  • skip_short_sessions (bool, default=True) – Should the algorithm skip short sessions when calculating MRR or should raise an error?

  • calc_mrr (bool, default = True) – Should MRR be calculated?

  • calc_precision (bool, default = True) – Should Precision be calculated?

  • calc_recall (bool, default = True) – Should Recall be calculated?

  • sliding_window (bool, default = False) – When calculating metrics slide through a single session up to the point when it is not possible to have the same number of evaluation products as the number of recommendations.

Returns

  • Dict

  • {‘MRR’ (float, ‘Recall’: float, ‘Precision’: float})
